title: Super Bowl 50
meta_description: San Francisco 49ers and fans have had some ups and downs since our first Super Bowl appearance in 1982 with a 26-21 victory over the Cincinnati Bengals in Pontiac, Michigan.
short_description: San Francisco 49ers and fans have had some ups and downs since our first Super Bowl appearance in 1982 with a 26-21 victory over the Cincinnati Bengals in Pontiac, Michigan.
long_description:
San Francisco 49ers and fans have had some ups and downs since our first Super Bowl appearance in 1982 with a 26-21 victory over the Cincinnati Bengals in Pontiac, Michigan. The glory days of Joe Montana and Jerry Rice of the ‘90s remind us why we start each season #49erFAITHFUL– all for the hope of kissing that trophy as the confetti cascades down. With a rough season for the Niners this year and no shot at the championship, the faithful fans are grateful to partake in the Super Bowl 50 festivities in a unique way.

In a few short days, Super Bowl 50 City hosted by Verizon will open near the Embarcadero and it is about to get nuts! A lot has changed since the Bay Area last hosted Super Bowl XIX in 1985 at Stanford Stadium and I’ve got all of the details on the best way to enjoy the Super Bowl!

Learn more of the History of San Francisco and the Super Bowl.

1st 49ers Win in Super Bowl XIV in 1982

2nd 49ers Win in Palo Alto at Stanford Stadium in 1985
Best events:
Super Bowl Calender on NFL.com

January 30: Super Bowl City hosted by Verizon

February 3: Matt Nathanson Free Concert

February 3: San Francisco Symphony and NFL Films: A Concert of Champions

February 6: Third Eye Blind

Download this Super Bowl app to keep tabs of all of the Super Bowl Festivities happening in the City!
